sentence: Colgate-Palmolive Company ( CL ) will begin trading ex-dividend on July 17, 2018.
A cash dividend payment of $0.42 per share is scheduled to be paid on August 15, 2018.
Shareholders who purchased CL prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 5% increase over prior dividend payment.
At the current stock price of $65.75, the dividend yield is 2.56%.
The previous trading day's last sale of CL was $65.75, representing a -15.61% decrease from the 52 week high of $77.91 and a 7.29% increase over the 52 week low of $61.28.
CL is a part of the Consumer Non-Durables sector, which includes companies such as Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) and Unilever NV ( UN ).
CL's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $2.36.
Zacks Investment Research reports CL's forecasted earnings growth in 2018 as 8.75%, compared to an industry average of 10.6%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the CL Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
